content: 1 In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Jerusalem､ and laid siege against it;
content_old: 1 In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Jerusalem､ and laid siege against it;

content: 2 and the Lord gave into his hand Jehoiakim king of Judah､ and a part of the vessels of the house of God, and he brought them into the land of Shinar､ into the house of his gods,—and the vessels brought he into the treasure-house of his gods.
content_old: 2 and the Lord gave into his hand Jehoiakim king of Judah､ and a part of the vessels of the house of God, and he brought them into the land of Shinar､ into the house of his gods,—and the vessels brought he into the treasure-house of his gods.

content: 3 Then did the king give word to Ashpenaz､ the chief of his eunuchs,—that he should bring in of the sons of Israel､ even of the seed royal､ and of the nobles
content_old: 3 Then did the king give word to Ashpenaz､ the chief of his eunuchs,—that he should bring in of the sons of Israel､ even of the seed royal､ and of the nobles

content: 4 youths in whom was no blemish､ but comely of countenance､ and skilful in all wisdom､ and possessed of knowledge､ and able to impart instruction, and who had vigour in them､ to stand in the palace of the king,—and that they should be taught the learning and the tongue of the Chaldeans.
content_old: 4 youths in whom was no blemish､ but comely of countenance､ and skilful in all wisdom､ and possessed of knowledge､ and able to impart instruction, and who had vigour in them､ to stand in the palace of the king,—and that they should be taught the learning and the tongue of the Chaldeans.

content: 5 And the king appointed them the provision of each day upon its day､ out of the delicacies of the king and out of the wine which he drank, and so to let them grow three years,—and at the end thereof that they should stand before the king.
content_old: 5 And the king appointed them the provision of each day upon its day､ out of the delicacies of the king and out of the wine which he drank, and so to let them grow three years,—and at the end thereof that they should stand before the king.

content: 6 Now there were､ among them､ out of the sons of Judah,—Daniel､ Hananiah, Mishael､ and Azariah;
content_old: 6 Now there were､ among them､ out of the sons of Judah,—Daniel､ Hananiah, Mishael､ and Azariah;

content: 7 and the ruler of the eunuchs gave them names,—yea he gave to Daniel the name of Belteshazzar, and to Hananiah of Shadrach, and to Mishael of Meshach, and to Azariah of Abed-nego.
content_old: 7 and the ruler of the eunuchs gave them names,—yea he gave to Daniel the name of Belteshazzar, and to Hananiah of Shadrach, and to Mishael of Meshach, and to Azariah of Abed-nego.

content: 8 But Daniel laid it upon his heart, that he would not defile himself with the delicacies of the king､ nor with the wine which he drank,—therefore sought he of the ruler of the eunuchs, that he might not defile himself.
content_old: 8 But Daniel laid it upon his heart, that he would not defile himself with the delicacies of the king､ nor with the wine which he drank,—therefore sought he of the ruler of the eunuchs, that he might not defile himself.

content: 9 But although God had brought Daniel into lovingkindness and tender compassion､ before the ruler of the eunuchs
content_old: 9 But although God had brought Daniel into lovingkindness and tender compassion､ before the ruler of the eunuchs

content: 10 yet said the ruler of the eunuchs unto Daniel, I､ do fear my lord the king､ who hath appointed your food and your drink,—for why should he see your faces more sad than those of the youths of your own age? so should ye bring me under the penalty of mine own head unto the king.
content_old: 10 yet said the ruler of the eunuchs unto Daniel, I､ do fear my lord the king､ who hath appointed your food and your drink,—for why should he see your faces more sad than those of the youths of your own age? so should ye bring me under the penalty of mine own head unto the king.

content: 11 Then said Daniel､ unto the overseer whom the ruler of the eunuchs had appointed over Daniel､ Hananiah, Mishael､ and Azariah:
content_old: 11 Then said Daniel､ unto the overseer whom the ruler of the eunuchs had appointed over Daniel､ Hananiah, Mishael､ and Azariah:

content: 12 I pray thee—prove thy servants､ ten days,—and let them give us vegetable food､ that we may eat､ and water that we may drink:
content_old: 12 I pray thee—prove thy servants､ ten days,—and let them give us vegetable food､ that we may eat､ and water that we may drink:

content: 13 then let our countenances be looked upon before thee, and the countenances of the youths who have been eating the delicacies of the king,—and as thou shalt see deal thou with thy servants.
content_old: 13 then let our countenances be looked upon before thee, and the countenances of the youths who have been eating the delicacies of the king,—and as thou shalt see deal thou with thy servants.

content: 14 So then he hearkened unto them､ according to this word,—and proved them ten days;
content_old: 14 So then he hearkened unto them､ according to this word,—and proved them ten days;

content: 15 and at the end of ten days their countenances appeared more comely, and fatter in flesh,—than any of the youths who had been eating the delicacies of the king.
content_old: 15 and at the end of ten days their countenances appeared more comely, and fatter in flesh,—than any of the youths who had been eating the delicacies of the king.

content: 16 Thus it came about that the overseer continued taking away their delicacies, and the wine appointed them to drink,—and kept on giving them vegetable food.
content_old: 16 Thus it came about that the overseer continued taking away their delicacies, and the wine appointed them to drink,—and kept on giving them vegetable food.

content: 17 And as for these four youths God gave them knowledge and skill､ in all learning and wisdom,—and Daniel had discernment, in all visions and dreams.
content_old: 17 And as for these four youths God gave them knowledge and skill､ in all learning and wisdom,—and Daniel had discernment, in all visions and dreams.

content: 18 Now at the end of the days after which the king had given word to bring them in then did the ruler of the eunuchs bring them in､ before Nebuchadnezzar.
content_old: 18 Now at the end of the days after which the king had given word to bring them in then did the ruler of the eunuchs bring them in､ before Nebuchadnezzar.

content: 19 So then the king spake with them, and there was not found､ from among them all, one like unto Daniel､ Hananiah, Mishael､ and Azariah,—therefore stood they before the king;
content_old: 19 So then the king spake with them, and there was not found､ from among them all, one like unto Daniel､ Hananiah, Mishael､ and Azariah,—therefore stood they before the king;

content: 20 and in any matter of wisdom and discernment as to which the king enquired of them he found them ten times better than all the sacred scribes—the magicians､ who were in all his realm.
content_old: 20 and in any matter of wisdom and discernment as to which the king enquired of them he found them ten times better than all the sacred scribes—the magicians､ who were in all his realm.

content: 1 And in the second year of the reign of Nebuchadnezzar Nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams,—and his spirit was troubled, and his sleep had gone from him.
content_old: 1 And in the second year of the reign of Nebuchadnezzar Nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams,—and his spirit was troubled, and his sleep had gone from him.

content: 2 So the king gave word to call for the sacred scribes and for the magicians､ and for the users of incantations､ and for the Chaldeans, that they might tell the king his dreams,—they came in therefore, and stood before the king.
content_old: 2 So the king gave word to call for the sacred scribes and for the magicians､ and for the users of incantations､ and for the Chaldeans, that they might tell the king his dreams,—they came in therefore, and stood before the king.

content: 3 And the king said to them､ A dream have I dreamed,—and my spirit is troubled to know the dream.
content_old: 3 And the king said to them､ A dream have I dreamed,—and my spirit is troubled to know the dream.

content: 4 Then spake the Chaldeans to the king､ in Aramaic,— O king to the ages live! Tell the dream to thy servants､ and the interpretation we will declare.
content_old: 4 Then spake the Chaldeans to the king､ in Aramaic,— O king to the ages live! Tell the dream to thy servants､ and the interpretation we will declare.

content: 5 The king answered and said to the Chaldeans, The word from me is unalterable: If ye shall not make known to me the dream and the interpretation thereof ye shall be cut in pieces､ and your houses into a dung-hill shall be turned;
content_old: 5 The king answered and said to the Chaldeans, The word from me is unalterable: If ye shall not make known to me the dream and the interpretation thereof ye shall be cut in pieces､ and your houses into a dung-hill shall be turned;

content: 6 but if the dream and the interpretation thereof ye will declare gifts and a present and great dignity shall ye receive from before me,—therefore the dream and the interpretation thereof declare ye unto me.
content_old: 6 but if the dream and the interpretation thereof ye will declare gifts and a present and great dignity shall ye receive from before me,—therefore the dream and the interpretation thereof declare ye unto me.

content: 7 They answered again and said,— Let the king tell the dream to his servants､ and the interpretation thereof we will declare.
content_old: 7 They answered again and said,— Let the king tell the dream to his servants､ and the interpretation thereof we will declare.

content: 8 The king answered and said, Of a certainty I know, that time ye would gain,—merely because ye see that unalterable､ from me is the word:
content_old: 8 The king answered and said, Of a certainty I know, that time ye would gain,—merely because ye see that unalterable､ from me is the word:

content: 9 That if the dream ye shall not make known to me one and the same is the decree､ and a lying and wicked word have ye agreed to speak before me, that meanwhile the time may be changed,—therefore the dream tell ye me, so shall I know that the interpretation thereof ye can declare for me.
content_old: 9 That if the dream ye shall not make known to me one and the same is the decree､ and a lying and wicked word have ye agreed to speak before me, that meanwhile the time may be changed,—therefore the dream tell ye me, so shall I know that the interpretation thereof ye can declare for me.

content: 10 The Chaldeans answered before the king and said, There is not a man upon the earth, who can declare the matter of the king,—although indeed there is no king､ chief or ruler who a thing like this hath asked of any sacred scribe or magician or Chaldean;
content_old: 10 The Chaldeans answered before the king and said, There is not a man upon the earth, who can declare the matter of the king,—although indeed there is no king､ chief or ruler who a thing like this hath asked of any sacred scribe or magician or Chaldean;

content: 11 and the thing which the king hath asked is difficult, and none other is there､ who can declare it before the king,—saving the gods whose dwelling is not with flesh.
content_old: 11 and the thing which the king hath asked is difficult, and none other is there､ who can declare it before the king,—saving the gods whose dwelling is not with flesh.

content: 12 For this cause the king was provoked and exceedingly indignant,—and gave word to destroy all the wise men of Babylon;
content_old: 12 For this cause the king was provoked and exceedingly indignant,—and gave word to destroy all the wise men of Babylon;

content: 13 and the decree went forth, that the wise men should be slain,—and they sought Daniel and his companions that they might be slain.
content_old: 13 and the decree went forth, that the wise men should be slain,—and they sought Daniel and his companions that they might be slain.

content: 14 Immediately Daniel made answer with prudence and discretion, to Arioch､ chief of the executioners of the king,—who had come forth to slay the wise men of Babylon:
content_old: 14 Immediately Daniel made answer with prudence and discretion, to Arioch､ chief of the executioners of the king,—who had come forth to slay the wise men of Babylon:

content: 15 he began to speak and said to Arioch the king’s captain,— For what cause is the decree raging forth from before the king? Then did Arioch make the matter known unto Daniel.
content_old: 15 he began to speak and said to Arioch the king’s captain,— For what cause is the decree raging forth from before the king? Then did Arioch make the matter known unto Daniel.

content: 16 So Daniel entered in､ and desired of the king,—that an appointed time he would give him, and then the interpretation he would declare unto the king.
content_old: 16 So Daniel entered in､ and desired of the king,—that an appointed time he would give him, and then the interpretation he would declare unto the king.

content: 17 Then Daniel to his own house departed,—and to Hananiah､ Mishael､ and Azariah､ his companions made the matter known;
content_old: 17 Then Daniel to his own house departed,—and to Hananiah､ Mishael､ and Azariah､ his companions made the matter known;

content: 18 that tender compassion they might seek from before the God of the heavens, concerning this secret,—that Daniel and his companions might not be destroyed, with the rest of the wise men of Babylon.
content_old: 18 that tender compassion they might seek from before the God of the heavens, concerning this secret,—that Daniel and his companions might not be destroyed, with the rest of the wise men of Babylon.

content: 19 Then unto Daniel—in a vision of the night the secret was revealed,—whereupon Daniel blessed the God of the heavens:
content_old: 19 Then unto Daniel—in a vision of the night the secret was revealed,—whereupon Daniel blessed the God of the heavens:

content: 20 Daniel responded､ and said, Let the name of God be blessed from age to age,— In that wisdom and might to him belong;
content_old: 20 Daniel responded､ and said, Let the name of God be blessed from age to age,— In that wisdom and might to him belong;

content: 21 And he changeth times and seasons, Removeth kings､ and setteth up kings,— Giving wisdom to the wise, And knowledge to them who are skilled in understanding:
content_old: 21 And he changeth times and seasons, Removeth kings､ and setteth up kings,— Giving wisdom to the wise, And knowledge to them who are skilled in understanding:

content: 22 He revealeth the deep things､ and the hidden,— Knoweth what is in the darkness, And light with him､ doth dwell.
content_old: 22 He revealeth the deep things､ and the hidden,— Knoweth what is in the darkness, And light with him､ doth dwell.

content: 23 Unto thee､ O God of my fathers do I render thanks and praise, In that wisdom and might thou hast given unto me,— Yea already hast thou made known to me､ that which we desired of thee, For the matter of the king hast thou made known unto us.
content_old: 23 Unto thee､ O God of my fathers do I render thanks and praise, In that wisdom and might thou hast given unto me,— Yea already hast thou made known to me､ that which we desired of thee, For the matter of the king hast thou made known unto us.

content: 24 Therefore Daniel entered in unto Arioch, whom the king had appointed to destroy the wise men of Babylon,—he went in､ and thus he said unto him､ The wise men of Babylon do not thou destroy, bring me in before the king, and the interpretation—unto the king will I declare.
content_old: 24 Therefore Daniel entered in unto Arioch, whom the king had appointed to destroy the wise men of Babylon,—he went in､ and thus he said unto him､ The wise men of Babylon do not thou destroy, bring me in before the king, and the interpretation—unto the king will I declare.

content: 25 Thereupon Arioch—with haste brought in Daniel before the king,—and thus he said to him— I have found a man of the sons of the exile of Judah, who the interpretation—unto the king will make known.
content_old: 25 Thereupon Arioch—with haste brought in Daniel before the king,—and thus he said to him— I have found a man of the sons of the exile of Judah, who the interpretation—unto the king will make known.

content: 26 The king answered and said unto Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar,— Art thou able to make known unto me the dream which I have seen､ and the interpretation thereof?
content_old: 26 The king answered and said unto Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar,— Art thou able to make known unto me the dream which I have seen､ and the interpretation thereof?

content: 27 Daniel answered before the king､ and said,— The secret which the king hath asked the wise men､ the magicians､ the sacred scribes､ the astrologers are not able to declare unto the king;
content_old: 27 Daniel answered before the king､ and said,— The secret which the king hath asked the wise men､ the magicians､ the sacred scribes､ the astrologers are not able to declare unto the king;

content: 28 but there is a God in the heavens､ who revealeth secrets, and hath made known to King Nebuchadnezzar､ what shall come to pass､ in the afterpart of the days: Thy dream and the visions of thy head upon thy bed are these:—
content_old: 28 but there is a God in the heavens､ who revealeth secrets, and hath made known to King Nebuchadnezzar､ what shall come to pass､ in the afterpart of the days: Thy dream and the visions of thy head upon thy bed are these:—

content: 29 As for thee､ O king thy thoughts upon thy bed arose regarding what should come to pass hereafter; and he that revealeth secrets made known to thee what shall come to pass.
content_old: 29 As for thee､ O king thy thoughts upon thy bed arose regarding what should come to pass hereafter; and he that revealeth secrets made known to thee what shall come to pass.

content: 30 But as for me—not for any wisdom that is in me､ more than any of the living is this secret revealed to me,—therefore it is in order that the interpretation—unto the king they should make known, and that the thoughts of thy heart thou shouldst get to know.
content_old: 30 But as for me—not for any wisdom that is in me､ more than any of the living is this secret revealed to me,—therefore it is in order that the interpretation—unto the king they should make known, and that the thoughts of thy heart thou shouldst get to know.

content: 31 As for thee､ O king thou wast looking､ when lo! a great image, this image､ being mighty､ and the brightness thereof surpassing was standing before thee,—and the appearance thereof was terrible.
content_old: 31 As for thee､ O king thou wast looking､ when lo! a great image, this image､ being mighty､ and the brightness thereof surpassing was standing before thee,—and the appearance thereof was terrible.

content: 32 As for this image its head was of fine gold, its breast and its arms were of silver,—its belly and its thighs of bronze;
content_old: 32 As for this image its head was of fine gold, its breast and its arms were of silver,—its belly and its thighs of bronze;

content: 33 its legs of iron,—and its feet part of them of iron, and part of them of clay.
content_old: 33 its legs of iron,—and its feet part of them of iron, and part of them of clay.

content: 34 Thou didst look､ until that a stone tare itself away､ not by the aid of hands, and smote the image upon its feet, which were of iron and clay,—and they were broken in pieces.
content_old: 34 Thou didst look､ until that a stone tare itself away､ not by the aid of hands, and smote the image upon its feet, which were of iron and clay,—and they were broken in pieces.

content: 35 Then were broken in pieces at once､ the iron､ the clay､ the bronze､ the silver､ and the gold, and became like chaff out of the summer threshing-floors､ and the wind carried them away､ and no place was found for them,—but the stone that smote the image became a mighty rock､ and filled all the land.
content_old: 35 Then were broken in pieces at once､ the iron､ the clay､ the bronze､ the silver､ and the gold, and became like chaff out of the summer threshing-floors､ and the wind carried them away､ and no place was found for them,—but the stone that smote the image became a mighty rock､ and filled all the land.

content: 36 This is the dream, and the interpretation thereof we will tell before the king.
content_old: 36 This is the dream, and the interpretation thereof we will tell before the king.

content: 37 Thou､ O king art the king of kings,—for the God of the heavens hath given unto thee the kingship､ the might､ the power and the dignity;
content_old: 37 Thou､ O king art the king of kings,—for the God of the heavens hath given unto thee the kingship､ the might､ the power and the dignity;

content: 38 and wheresoever the sons of men do dwell the wild beasts of the field and the birds of the heavens hath he given into thy hand, and hath made thee ruler over them all. Thou art the head of gold.
content_old: 38 and wheresoever the sons of men do dwell the wild beasts of the field and the birds of the heavens hath he given into thy hand, and hath made thee ruler over them all. Thou art the head of gold.

content: 39 And after thee shall arise another kingdom､ inferior to thee,— and another—a third kingdom､ of bronze, which shall bear rule throughout all the earth.
content_old: 39 And after thee shall arise another kingdom､ inferior to thee,— and another—a third kingdom､ of bronze, which shall bear rule throughout all the earth.

content: 40 And the fourth kingdom shall be hard as iron,—in like manner as iron breaketh in pieces and crusheth all things,—even as iron which bringeth to ruins all these shall it break in pieces and bring to ruins.
content_old: 40 And the fourth kingdom shall be hard as iron,—in like manner as iron breaketh in pieces and crusheth all things,—even as iron which bringeth to ruins all these shall it break in pieces and bring to ruins.

content: 41 And whereas thou sawest the feet and the toes､ part of them of potter’s clay､ and part of them of iron the kingdom shall be divided, and of the hardness of the iron shall there be in it,—forasmuch as thou sawest the iron combined with the miry clay;
content_old: 41 And whereas thou sawest the feet and the toes､ part of them of potter’s clay､ and part of them of iron the kingdom shall be divided, and of the hardness of the iron shall there be in it,—forasmuch as thou sawest the iron combined with the miry clay;

content: 42 and the toes of the feet part of them iron､ and part of clay,—some part of the kingdom shall be strong, but a part thereof shall be brittle;
content_old: 42 and the toes of the feet part of them iron､ and part of clay,—some part of the kingdom shall be strong, but a part thereof shall be brittle;

content: 43 and whereas thou sawest the iron combined with the miry clay they shall be combined with the seed of men, but shall not cleave firmly one to another,—lo! as iron is not to be combined with clay.
content_old: 43 and whereas thou sawest the iron combined with the miry clay they shall be combined with the seed of men, but shall not cleave firmly one to another,—lo! as iron is not to be combined with clay.

content: 44 And in the days of those kings shall the God of the heavens set up a kingdom､ which to the ages shall not be destroyed, and the kingdom to another people shall not be left,—it shall break in pieces and make an end of all these kingdoms, but itself shall stand to the ages.
content_old: 44 And in the days of those kings shall the God of the heavens set up a kingdom､ which to the ages shall not be destroyed, and the kingdom to another people shall not be left,—it shall break in pieces and make an end of all these kingdoms, but itself shall stand to the ages.

content: 45 Forasmuch as thou sawest that out of the rock a stone tare itself away､ but not with hands､ and brake in pieces the clay､ the iron､ the bronze､ the silver and the gold the mighty God hath made known to the king what shall come to pass hereafter. Exact then is the dream､ And trusty its interpretation.
content_old: 45 Forasmuch as thou sawest that out of the rock a stone tare itself away､ but not with hands､ and brake in pieces the clay､ the iron､ the bronze､ the silver and the gold the mighty God hath made known to the king what shall come to pass hereafter. Exact then is the dream､ And trusty its interpretation.

content: 46 Then King Nebuchadnezzar fell upon his face, and unto Daniel paid adoration; and a present and sweet odours gave he word to pour out unto him.
content_old: 46 Then King Nebuchadnezzar fell upon his face, and unto Daniel paid adoration; and a present and sweet odours gave he word to pour out unto him.

content: 47 The king answered Daniel､ and said— Of a truth your God is a God of gods､ and a Lord of kings､ and a Revealer of secrets,—seeing thou wast able to reveal this secret.
content_old: 47 The king answered Daniel､ and said— Of a truth your God is a God of gods､ and a Lord of kings､ and a Revealer of secrets,—seeing thou wast able to reveal this secret.

content: 48 Then the king exalted Daniel､ and many large presents gave he unto him, and set him to be ruler over all the province of Babylon,—and chief of the nobles, over all the wise men of Babylon.
content_old: 48 Then the king exalted Daniel､ and many large presents gave he unto him, and set him to be ruler over all the province of Babylon,—and chief of the nobles, over all the wise men of Babylon.

content: 1 Nebuchadnezzar the king made an image of gold, the height thereof sixty cubits､ the breadth thereof six cubits,—he set it up in the valley of Dura, in the province of Babylon.
content_old: 1 Nebuchadnezzar the king made an image of gold, the height thereof sixty cubits､ the breadth thereof six cubits,—he set it up in the valley of Dura, in the province of Babylon.

content: 2 And Nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather together the satraps､ the nobles and the pashas, the chief judges､ the treasurers､ the judges､ the lawyers, and all the rulers of the province,—to come to the dedication of the image, which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.
content_old: 2 And Nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather together the satraps､ the nobles and the pashas, the chief judges､ the treasurers､ the judges､ the lawyers, and all the rulers of the province,—to come to the dedication of the image, which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.

content: 3 Then were gathered together､ the satraps､ the nobles and the pashas, the chief judges､ the treasurers, the judges, the lawyers､ and all the rulers of the province, to the dedication of the image､ which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up,—and they stood before the image, which Nebuchadnezzar had set up.
content_old: 3 Then were gathered together､ the satraps､ the nobles and the pashas, the chief judges､ the treasurers, the judges, the lawyers､ and all the rulers of the province, to the dedication of the image､ which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up,—and they stood before the image, which Nebuchadnezzar had set up.

content: 4 And the herald proclaimed aloud,— To you is given the word､ O ye peoples, races､ and tongues:
content_old: 4 And the herald proclaimed aloud,— To you is given the word､ O ye peoples, races､ and tongues:

content: 5 At what time ye shall hear the sound of the horn､ the pipe､ the lyre､ the harp､ the psaltery､ the bagpipes, and all kinds of instruments of music ye shall fall down and adore the image of gold, which Nebuchadnezzar the king hath set up;
content_old: 5 At what time ye shall hear the sound of the horn､ the pipe､ the lyre､ the harp､ the psaltery､ the bagpipes, and all kinds of instruments of music ye shall fall down and adore the image of gold, which Nebuchadnezzar the king hath set up;

content: 6 and whosoever shall not fall down and adore shall instantly be cast into the burning furnace of fire.
content_old: 6 and whosoever shall not fall down and adore shall instantly be cast into the burning furnace of fire.

content: 7 Wherefore at the same time—when all the peoples heard the sound of the horn､ the pipe､ the lyre､ the harp､ the psaltery, and all kinds of instruments of music they were falling down—even all the peoples､ the races､ and the tongues､—adoring the image of gold, which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.
content_old: 7 Wherefore at the same time—when all the peoples heard the sound of the horn､ the pipe､ the lyre､ the harp､ the psaltery, and all kinds of instruments of music they were falling down—even all the peoples､ the races､ and the tongues､—adoring the image of gold, which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.

content: 8 Wherefore at the same time drew near certain Chaldeans,—and accused the Jews:
content_old: 8 Wherefore at the same time drew near certain Chaldeans,—and accused the Jews:

content: 9 they spake､ and said, to Nebuchadnezzar the king: O king! for ages live!
content_old: 9 they spake､ and said, to Nebuchadnezzar the king: O king! for ages live!

content: 10 Thou thyself､ O king､ hast made a decree, that any man who shall hear the sound of the horn､ the pipe､ the lyre､ the harp､ the psaltery and the bagpipes, and all kinds of instruments of music shall fall down and adore the image of gold;
content_old: 10 Thou thyself､ O king､ hast made a decree, that any man who shall hear the sound of the horn､ the pipe､ the lyre､ the harp､ the psaltery and the bagpipes, and all kinds of instruments of music shall fall down and adore the image of gold;

content: 11 and whosoever shall not fall down and adore shall be cast into the burning furnace of fire.
content_old: 11 and whosoever shall not fall down and adore shall be cast into the burning furnace of fire.

content: 12 There are certain Jews whom thou hast set over the business of the province of Babylon, Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego,—these men have made thee､ O king､ of no account, thy god they serve not, and the image of gold which thou hast set up do they not adore.
content_old: 12 There are certain Jews whom thou hast set over the business of the province of Babylon, Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego,—these men have made thee､ O king､ of no account, thy god they serve not, and the image of gold which thou hast set up do they not adore.

content: 13 Then Nebuchadnezzar—with anger and wrath gave word to bring Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego, then these men brought they before the king.
content_old: 13 Then Nebuchadnezzar—with anger and wrath gave word to bring Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego, then these men brought they before the king.

content: 14 Nebuchadnezzar spake and said unto them, Is it with design O Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego,—that my god ye are not serving, and the image which I have set up are not adoring?
content_old: 14 Nebuchadnezzar spake and said unto them, Is it with design O Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego,—that my god ye are not serving, and the image which I have set up are not adoring?

content: 15 Now if ye be ready at what time ye shall hear the sound of the cornet､ the pipe､ the lyre､ the harp､ the psaltery and the bagpipes､ and all the instruments of music ye shall fall down and adore the image which I have made, but if ye shall not adore instantly shall ye be cast into the midst of the burning furnace of fire,—and who is the god that shall deliver you out of my hands?
content_old: 15 Now if ye be ready at what time ye shall hear the sound of the cornet､ the pipe､ the lyre､ the harp､ the psaltery and the bagpipes､ and all the instruments of music ye shall fall down and adore the image which I have made, but if ye shall not adore instantly shall ye be cast into the midst of the burning furnace of fire,—and who is the god that shall deliver you out of my hands?

content: 16 Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego answered, and said to the king: O Nebuchadnezzar! we are not accounting it needful､ concerning this to answer thee.
content_old: 16 Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego answered, and said to the king: O Nebuchadnezzar! we are not accounting it needful､ concerning this to answer thee.

content: 17 If it is our God､ whom we serve is able to deliver us,—out of the burning furnace of fire, and out of thy hand O king､ he will deliver.
content_old: 17 If it is our God､ whom we serve is able to deliver us,—out of the burning furnace of fire, and out of thy hand O king､ he will deliver.

content: 18 But if not be it known to thee､ O king,—that thy god will we not serve, and the image of gold which thou hast set up will we not adore.
content_old: 18 But if not be it known to thee､ O king,—that thy god will we not serve, and the image of gold which thou hast set up will we not adore.

content: 19 Then Nebuchadnezzar was filled with wrath､ and the likeness of his countenance was changed, against Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego,—he spake and gave word to heat the furnace seven times hotter than it was ever seen heated;
content_old: 19 Then Nebuchadnezzar was filled with wrath､ and the likeness of his countenance was changed, against Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego,—he spake and gave word to heat the furnace seven times hotter than it was ever seen heated;

content: 20 and to men､ who were the mightiest men in his army gave he word to bind fast Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego,—to cast them into the burning furnace of fire.
content_old: 20 and to men､ who were the mightiest men in his army gave he word to bind fast Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego,—to cast them into the burning furnace of fire.

content: 21 Then bound they these men in their trousers､ their tunics､ and their cloaks､ and their (other) clothing,—and cast into the midst of the burning furnace of fire.
content_old: 21 Then bound they these men in their trousers､ their tunics､ and their cloaks､ and their (other) clothing,—and cast into the midst of the burning furnace of fire.

content: 22 Therefore､ because the word of the king had raged forth, and the furnace was exceeding hot those very men who took up Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego were slain by the flame of the fire;
content_old: 22 Therefore､ because the word of the king had raged forth, and the furnace was exceeding hot those very men who took up Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego were slain by the flame of the fire;

content: 23 and these three men, Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego fell down into the midst of the burning furnace of fire､ fast bound.
content_old: 23 and these three men, Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego fell down into the midst of the burning furnace of fire､ fast bound.

content: 24 Then Nebuchadnezzar the king was amazed､ and rose up in haste: he spake and said to his nearest friends— Where they not three men､ we cast into the midst of the fire､ fast bound? They answered and said to the king､ Surely､ O king!
content_old: 24 Then Nebuchadnezzar the king was amazed､ and rose up in haste: he spake and said to his nearest friends— Where they not three men､ we cast into the midst of the fire､ fast bound? They answered and said to the king､ Surely､ O king!

content: 25 He answered and said､ Lo! I see four men､ unbound､ walking in the midst of the fire, and injury there is not in them, and the appearance of the fourth is like to a son of the gods!
content_old: 25 He answered and said､ Lo! I see four men､ unbound､ walking in the midst of the fire, and injury there is not in them, and the appearance of the fourth is like to a son of the gods!

content: 26 Then did Nebuchadnezzar draw near to the door of the burning furnace of fire, he spake and said､ Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego, ye servants of the most high God, step forth and come hither. Then stepped forth Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego, out of the midst of the fire.
content_old: 26 Then did Nebuchadnezzar draw near to the door of the burning furnace of fire, he spake and said､ Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego, ye servants of the most high God, step forth and come hither. Then stepped forth Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego, out of the midst of the fire.

content: 27 And—being gathered together—the satraps､ the nobles､ and the pashas and near friends of the king､ saw these men､ over whose bodies the fire had no power, nor was a hair of their head singed､ neither were their trousers disfigured,—nor had the smell of fire come upon them.
content_old: 27 And—being gathered together—the satraps､ the nobles､ and the pashas and near friends of the king､ saw these men､ over whose bodies the fire had no power, nor was a hair of their head singed､ neither were their trousers disfigured,—nor had the smell of fire come upon them.

content: 28 Nebuchadnezzar spake and said､ Blessed be the God of Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego, who hath sent his messenger､ and delivered his servants, who trusted in him,—when the word of the king they transgressed, and delivered up their bodies､ that they might not serve nor adore any god, saving their own God.
content_old: 28 Nebuchadnezzar spake and said､ Blessed be the God of Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego, who hath sent his messenger､ and delivered his servants, who trusted in him,—when the word of the king they transgressed, and delivered up their bodies､ that they might not serve nor adore any god, saving their own God.

content: 29 Therefore do I make a decree, that whosoever of any people､ race､ or tongue it be that shall charge any error upon the God of Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego shall be cut in pieces, and his house into a dunghill shall be changed; because there is no other God, who is able to deliver､ like this!
content_old: 29 Therefore do I make a decree, that whosoever of any people､ race､ or tongue it be that shall charge any error upon the God of Shadrach､ Meshach､ and Abed-nego shall be cut in pieces, and his house into a dunghill shall be changed; because there is no other God, who is able to deliver､ like this!

content: 1 Nebuchadnezzar the king unto all the peoples､ the races and the tongues who are dwelling in all the earth､ Let your prosperity abound!
content_old: 1 Nebuchadnezzar the king unto all the peoples､ the races and the tongues who are dwelling in all the earth､ Let your prosperity abound!

content: 2 The signs､ and the wonders, which the most high God hath wrought with me it is pleasing before me to declare.
content_old: 2 The signs､ and the wonders, which the most high God hath wrought with me it is pleasing before me to declare.

content: 3 His signs how great! And his wonders how mighty! His kingdom is an age-abiding kingdom, And his dominion lasteth from generation to generation.
content_old: 3 His signs how great! And his wonders how mighty! His kingdom is an age-abiding kingdom, And his dominion lasteth from generation to generation.

content: 4 I, Nebuchadnezzar was at peace in mine own house, and was prosperous in my palace.
content_old: 4 I, Nebuchadnezzar was at peace in mine own house, and was prosperous in my palace.

content: 5 A dream I saw､ and it made me afraid,—and fancies upon my bed, and visions of my head terrified me.
content_old: 5 A dream I saw､ and it made me afraid,—and fancies upon my bed, and visions of my head terrified me.

content: 6 Therefore made I a decree, to bring in before me､ all the wise men of Babylon,—who the interpretation of the dream should make known to me.
content_old: 6 Therefore made I a decree, to bring in before me､ all the wise men of Babylon,—who the interpretation of the dream should make known to me.

content: 7 Then came in the sacred scribes､ the magicians, the Chaldeans､ and the astrologers,—and the dream told I before them, but the interpretation could they not make known to me.
content_old: 7 Then came in the sacred scribes､ the magicians, the Chaldeans､ and the astrologers,—and the dream told I before them, but the interpretation could they not make known to me.

content: 8 Howbeit at last came before me—Daniel､ whose name was Belteshazzar､ after the name of my god, and in whom is the spirit of the holy gods; and the dream—before him I told saying:
content_old: 8 Howbeit at last came before me—Daniel､ whose name was Belteshazzar､ after the name of my god, and in whom is the spirit of the holy gods; and the dream—before him I told saying:

content: 9 O Belteshazzar､ chief of the sacred scribes, because I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in thee,—and no secret giveth thee trouble therefore the visions of my dream which I have seen､ and the interpretation thereof do thou tell.
content_old: 9 O Belteshazzar､ chief of the sacred scribes, because I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in thee,—and no secret giveth thee trouble therefore the visions of my dream which I have seen､ and the interpretation thereof do thou tell.

content: 10 The visions then of my head upon my bed were these,— I was looking､ when lo! a tree in the midst of the land､ And the height thereof was great.
content_old: 10 The visions then of my head upon my bed were these,— I was looking､ when lo! a tree in the midst of the land､ And the height thereof was great.

content: 11 The tree grew､ and became strong,— And the height thereof reached unto the heavens, And the view thereof unto the end of all the land:
content_old: 11 The tree grew､ and became strong,— And the height thereof reached unto the heavens, And the view thereof unto the end of all the land:

content: 12 The foliage thereof was beautiful､ And the fruit thereof abundant, And there was food for all therein,— Under it the wild beast of the field found shade､ And among its branches dwelt the birds of the heavens, And therefrom was well fed all flesh.
content_old: 12 The foliage thereof was beautiful､ And the fruit thereof abundant, And there was food for all therein,— Under it the wild beast of the field found shade､ And among its branches dwelt the birds of the heavens, And therefrom was well fed all flesh.

content: 13 I was looking､ in the visions of my head､ upon my bed, when lo! a watcher and holy one out of the heavens coming down.
content_old: 13 I was looking､ in the visions of my head､ upon my bed, when lo! a watcher and holy one out of the heavens coming down.

content: 14 He cried aloud､ and thus he said— Hew ye down the tree､ And lop off its branches, Strip off its leaves､ And scatter its fruit,— Let the wild beasts flee from under it, And the birds､ out of its branches;
content_old: 14 He cried aloud､ and thus he said— Hew ye down the tree､ And lop off its branches, Strip off its leaves､ And scatter its fruit,— Let the wild beasts flee from under it, And the birds､ out of its branches;

content: 15 Nevertheless､ the stock of its roots in the earth leave ye, yea in a bond of iron and bronze､ in the tender grass of the field, And with the dew of the heavens let it be drenched, And with the wild beasts be its portion､ amongst the herbage of the earth;
content_old: 15 Nevertheless､ the stock of its roots in the earth leave ye, yea in a bond of iron and bronze､ in the tender grass of the field, And with the dew of the heavens let it be drenched, And with the wild beasts be its portion､ amongst the herbage of the earth;

content: 16 Let its heart from a man’s be changed, And the heart of a wild beast be given to it,— And let seven seasons pass over it.
content_old: 16 Let its heart from a man’s be changed, And the heart of a wild beast be given to it,— And let seven seasons pass over it.

content: 17 By the decree of the watchers is the thing, And by the mandate of the holy ones the matter: To the intent that the living may get to know that the Most High hath dominion over the kingdom of men､ and to whomsoever he pleaseth he giveth it, and one low among men he setteth up over it.
content_old: 17 By the decree of the watchers is the thing, And by the mandate of the holy ones the matter: To the intent that the living may get to know that the Most High hath dominion over the kingdom of men､ and to whomsoever he pleaseth he giveth it, and one low among men he setteth up over it.

content: 18 This dream have I, King Nebuchadnezzar seen. Thou､ therefore､ O Belteshazzar the interpretation do thou tell､ foras-much as all the wise men of my kingdom are unable the interpretation to make known to me, but thou art able､ because the spirit of the holy gods is in thee.
content_old: 18 This dream have I, King Nebuchadnezzar seen. Thou､ therefore､ O Belteshazzar the interpretation do thou tell､ foras-much as all the wise men of my kingdom are unable the interpretation to make known to me, but thou art able､ because the spirit of the holy gods is in thee.

content: 19 Then Daniel､ whose name was Belteshazzar was astonished for about one moment. and his thoughts troubled him. The king spake and said､ O Belteshazzar､ let neither the dream､ nor the interpretation trouble thee. Belteshazzar answered and said, My Lord､ The dream be for them who hate thee､ And the interpretation for them who are thy foes.
content_old: 19 Then Daniel､ whose name was Belteshazzar was astonished for about one moment. and his thoughts troubled him. The king spake and said､ O Belteshazzar､ let neither the dream､ nor the interpretation trouble thee. Belteshazzar answered and said, My Lord､ The dream be for them who hate thee､ And the interpretation for them who are thy foes.

content: 20 The tree which thou sawest, which grew and became strong, Whose height reached unto the heavens, And the view thereof to all the earth:
content_old: 20 The tree which thou sawest, which grew and became strong, Whose height reached unto the heavens, And the view thereof to all the earth:

content: 21 Whose foliage was beautiful､ And whose fruit abundant, And food for all was in it,— Under it dwelt the wild beasts of the field, And in the branches thereof nestled the birds of the heavens:
content_old: 21 Whose foliage was beautiful､ And whose fruit abundant, And food for all was in it,— Under it dwelt the wild beasts of the field, And in the branches thereof nestled the birds of the heavens:

content: 22 Thyself it is､ O king, in that thou art grown､ and become strong,—and thy greatness hath grown､ and reached to the heavens, and thy dominion to the end of the earth.
content_old: 22 Thyself it is､ O king, in that thou art grown､ and become strong,—and thy greatness hath grown､ and reached to the heavens, and thy dominion to the end of the earth.

content: 23 And whereas the king saw a watcher and holy one coming down out of the heavens､ who said､ Hew ye down the tree and despoil it､ Nevertheless the stock of its roots—in the earth leave ye, even in a bond of iron and bronze､ in the tender grass of the field,— And with the dew of the heavens let it be drenched､ and along with the wild beasts of the field be its portion, Until that seven seasons pass over it
content_old: 23 And whereas the king saw a watcher and holy one coming down out of the heavens､ who said､ Hew ye down the tree and despoil it､ Nevertheless the stock of its roots—in the earth leave ye, even in a bond of iron and bronze､ in the tender grass of the field,— And with the dew of the heavens let it be drenched､ and along with the wild beasts of the field be its portion, Until that seven seasons pass over it

content: 24 This is the interpretation､ O king,—and the decree of the Most High it is, which hath come upon my lord the king:
content_old: 24 This is the interpretation､ O king,—and the decree of the Most High it is, which hath come upon my lord the king:

content: 25 That thee are they going to drive forth from among men､ And along with the wild beasts of the field shall be thy dwelling､ And grass—like oxen will they suffer thee to eat､ And with the dew of the heavens will they suffer thee to be drenched, And seven seasons shall pass over thee,— Until that thou come to know､ that the Most High hath dominion over the kingdom of men, And to whomsoever he pleaseth he giveth it.
content_old: 25 That thee are they going to drive forth from among men､ And along with the wild beasts of the field shall be thy dwelling､ And grass—like oxen will they suffer thee to eat､ And with the dew of the heavens will they suffer thee to be drenched, And seven seasons shall pass over thee,— Until that thou come to know､ that the Most High hath dominion over the kingdom of men, And to whomsoever he pleaseth he giveth it.

content: 26 And whereas they gave word to leave the stock of the roots of the tree thy kingdom unto thee is sure,—after that thou come to know, that the heavens have dominion.
content_old: 26 And whereas they gave word to leave the stock of the roots of the tree thy kingdom unto thee is sure,—after that thou come to know, that the heavens have dominion.

content: 27 Wherefore､ O king､ let my counsel be pleasing unto thee, Thy sin､ then､—by righteousness break thou off､ And thine iniquities by shewing favour to the oppressed,— If so be it may become the lengthening out of thy security.
content_old: 27 Wherefore､ O king､ let my counsel be pleasing unto thee, Thy sin､ then､—by righteousness break thou off､ And thine iniquities by shewing favour to the oppressed,— If so be it may become the lengthening out of thy security.

content: 28 All this came upon Nebuchadnezzar the king.
content_old: 28 All this came upon Nebuchadnezzar the king.

content: 29 At the end of twelve months over the palace of the kingdom of BabyIon was he walking:
content_old: 29 At the end of twelve months over the palace of the kingdom of BabyIon was he walking:

content: 30 the king spake and said, Is not this Babylon the great,—which I myself have built as the home of the kingdom, by the might of my power､ and for the dignity of my majesty?
content_old: 30 the king spake and said, Is not this Babylon the great,—which I myself have built as the home of the kingdom, by the might of my power､ and for the dignity of my majesty?

content: 31 While yet the word was in the mouth of the king a voice out of the heavens fell,— Unto thee is it said､ O Nebuchadnezzar the king, The kingdom hath departed from thee;
content_old: 31 While yet the word was in the mouth of the king a voice out of the heavens fell,— Unto thee is it said､ O Nebuchadnezzar the king, The kingdom hath departed from thee;

content: 32 And from among men are they going to drive thee forth､ And with the wild beast of the field shall be thy dwelling､ Grass—like oxen will they suffer thee to eat, And seven seasons shall pass over thee,— Until that thou come to know that the Most High hath dominion over the kingdom of men, and to whomsoever he pleaseth he giveth it.
content_old: 32 And from among men are they going to drive thee forth､ And with the wild beast of the field shall be thy dwelling､ Grass—like oxen will they suffer thee to eat, And seven seasons shall pass over thee,— Until that thou come to know that the Most High hath dominion over the kingdom of men, and to whomsoever he pleaseth he giveth it.

content: 33 Immediately the word was fulfilled upon Nebuchadnezzar, And from among men was he driven forth､ And grass—like oxen did he eat､ And with the dew of the heavens his body was drenched,—until that his hair like to eagles’ feathers was grown､ and his nails､ like birds’ claws.
content_old: 33 Immediately the word was fulfilled upon Nebuchadnezzar, And from among men was he driven forth､ And grass—like oxen did he eat､ And with the dew of the heavens his body was drenched,—until that his hair like to eagles’ feathers was grown､ and his nails､ like birds’ claws.

content: 34 And at the end of the days I､ Nebuchadnezzar､ mine eyes unto the heavens did uplift, And mine understanding unto me returned, And the Most High I blessed､ And to him that liveth age-abidingly I rendered praise and honour,— Whose dominion is an age-abiding dominion, And his kingdom lasteth from generation to generation;
content_old: 34 And at the end of the days I､ Nebuchadnezzar､ mine eyes unto the heavens did uplift, And mine understanding unto me returned, And the Most High I blessed､ And to him that liveth age-abidingly I rendered praise and honour,— Whose dominion is an age-abiding dominion, And his kingdom lasteth from generation to generation;

content: 35 And all the inhabitants of the earth as nothing are accounted, And according to his own pleasure dealeth he— With the army of the heavens, And the inhabitants of the earth,— And none there is who can smite upon his hand, Or say to him､ What hast thou done?
content_old: 35 And all the inhabitants of the earth as nothing are accounted, And according to his own pleasure dealeth he— With the army of the heavens, And the inhabitants of the earth,— And none there is who can smite upon his hand, Or say to him､ What hast thou done?

content: 36 At the same time mine understanding returned unto me､ And for the dignity of my kingdom my majesty and my brightness returned unto me, And unto me my nearest friends and my nobles did seek,— And over my kingdom was I restored, And surpassing greatness was added unto me.
content_old: 36 At the same time mine understanding returned unto me､ And for the dignity of my kingdom my majesty and my brightness returned unto me, And unto me my nearest friends and my nobles did seek,— And over my kingdom was I restored, And surpassing greatness was added unto me.

content: 1 Belshazzar the king made a great feast, to a thousand of his nobles,—and before the thousand was drinking wine.
content_old: 1 Belshazzar the king made a great feast, to a thousand of his nobles,—and before the thousand was drinking wine.

content: 2 Belshazzar gave word､ at the flavour of the wine､ to bring the vessels of gold and silver, which Nebuchadnezzar his father had brought forth out of the temple which was in Jerusalem,—that the king and his nobles, his wives and his concubines might drink therein.
content_old: 2 Belshazzar gave word､ at the flavour of the wine､ to bring the vessels of gold and silver, which Nebuchadnezzar his father had brought forth out of the temple which was in Jerusalem,—that the king and his nobles, his wives and his concubines might drink therein.

content: 3 Then brought they the vessels of gold which had been taken out of the temple of the house of God､ which was in Jerusalem,—and the king and his nobles､ his wives and his concubines､ drank therein:
content_old: 3 Then brought they the vessels of gold which had been taken out of the temple of the house of God､ which was in Jerusalem,—and the king and his nobles､ his wives and his concubines､ drank therein:

content: 4 they drank wine,—and praised the gods of gold and silver､ bronze､ iron, wood and stone.
content_old: 4 they drank wine,—and praised the gods of gold and silver､ bronze､ iron, wood and stone.

content: 5 Immediately came forth the fingers of the hand of a man, and wrote､ over against the chandelier､ upon the plaster of the wall of the palace of the king,—and the king saw the part of the hand which was writing.
content_old: 5 Immediately came forth the fingers of the hand of a man, and wrote､ over against the chandelier､ upon the plaster of the wall of the palace of the king,—and the king saw the part of the hand which was writing.

content: 6 Then as for the king his bright looks changed in him, and his thoughts terrified him,—and the joints of his loins were loosed, and his knees smote one against another.
content_old: 6 Then as for the king his bright looks changed in him, and his thoughts terrified him,—and the joints of his loins were loosed, and his knees smote one against another.

content: 7 The king began crying out amain, to bring in the magicians､ the Chaldeans and the astrologers,—the king spake and said to the wise men of Babylon､ Whosoever it is that shall read this writing､ and the interpretation thereof shall declare unto me, With purple shall he be clothed､ And have a chain of gold upon his neck､ And as the third in the kingdom shall he have dominion.
content_old: 7 The king began crying out amain, to bring in the magicians､ the Chaldeans and the astrologers,—the king spake and said to the wise men of Babylon､ Whosoever it is that shall read this writing､ and the interpretation thereof shall declare unto me, With purple shall he be clothed､ And have a chain of gold upon his neck､ And as the third in the kingdom shall he have dominion.

content: 8 Then were coming in all the wise men of the king,—but the writing could they not read, nor the interpretation make known to the king.
content_old: 8 Then were coming in all the wise men of the king,—but the writing could they not read, nor the interpretation make known to the king.

content: 9 Then King Belshazzar was greatly terrified, and his bright looks were changed upon him,—and his nobles were perplexed.
content_old: 9 Then King Belshazzar was greatly terrified, and his bright looks were changed upon him,—and his nobles were perplexed.

content: 10 The queen by reason of the words of the king and his nobles into the house of banqueting entered,—the queen spake and said､ O king! for ages live! Let not thy thoughts terrify thee, and as for thy bright looks let them not be changed.
content_old: 10 The queen by reason of the words of the king and his nobles into the house of banqueting entered,—the queen spake and said､ O king! for ages live! Let not thy thoughts terrify thee, and as for thy bright looks let them not be changed.

content: 11 There is a man in thy kingdom in whom is the spirit of the holy gods､ and in the days of thy father light､ and intelligence､ and wisdom like the wisdom of the gods were found in him,—and King Nebuchadnezzar thy father appointed him chief of the sacred scribes､ the magicians､ the Chaldeans､ and the astrologers—thy father､ O king!
content_old: 11 There is a man in thy kingdom in whom is the spirit of the holy gods､ and in the days of thy father light､ and intelligence､ and wisdom like the wisdom of the gods were found in him,—and King Nebuchadnezzar thy father appointed him chief of the sacred scribes､ the magicians､ the Chaldeans､ and the astrologers—thy father､ O king!

content: 12 Forasmuch as a distinguished spirit､ and knowledge and intelligence､ ability to interpret dreams and solve riddles and unravel knotty points were found in the same Daniel, whom the king named Belteshazzar now let Daniel be called､ and the interpretation will he declare.
content_old: 12 Forasmuch as a distinguished spirit､ and knowledge and intelligence､ ability to interpret dreams and solve riddles and unravel knotty points were found in the same Daniel, whom the king named Belteshazzar now let Daniel be called､ and the interpretation will he declare.

content: 13 Then Daniel was brought in before the king,—the king spake and said unto Daniel､ Art thou that Daniel､ that is of the sons of the exile of Judah, whom the king my father brought out of Judah?
content_old: 13 Then Daniel was brought in before the king,—the king spake and said unto Daniel､ Art thou that Daniel､ that is of the sons of the exile of Judah, whom the king my father brought out of Judah?

content: 14 Then､ I have heard concerning thee, that the spirit of the gods is in thee,—and light and intelligence and distinguished wisdom are found in thee.
content_old: 14 Then､ I have heard concerning thee, that the spirit of the gods is in thee,—and light and intelligence and distinguished wisdom are found in thee.

content: 15 Now､ therefore､ have been brought in before me､ the wise men､ the magicians, that this writing they might read､ and the interpretation thereof might make known unto me,—but they were not able the interpretation of the thing to declare.
content_old: 15 Now､ therefore､ have been brought in before me､ the wise men､ the magicians, that this writing they might read､ and the interpretation thereof might make known unto me,—but they were not able the interpretation of the thing to declare.

content: 16 I however､ have heard concerning thee, that thou art able､ interpretations to unfold and knotty points to unravel,— Now if thou be able the writing to read､ and the interpretation thereof to make known unto me with purple shalt thou be clothed､ and a chain of gold shalt thou have upon thy neck, and as the third in the kingdom shalt thou have dominion.
content_old: 16 I however､ have heard concerning thee, that thou art able､ interpretations to unfold and knotty points to unravel,— Now if thou be able the writing to read､ and the interpretation thereof to make known unto me with purple shalt thou be clothed､ and a chain of gold shalt thou have upon thy neck, and as the third in the kingdom shalt thou have dominion.

content: 17 Then spake Daniel､ and said before the king, As for thy gifts thine own let them remain､ And thy presents on another bestow,— Howbeit the writing will I read to the king, And the interpretation thereof will I make known to him.
content_old: 17 Then spake Daniel､ and said before the king, As for thy gifts thine own let them remain､ And thy presents on another bestow,— Howbeit the writing will I read to the king, And the interpretation thereof will I make known to him.

content: 18 As for thee､ O king the Most High God gave kingship and greatness and honour and majesty unto Nebuchadnezzar thy father;
